info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 2:54PM CDT until June 15 at 1:35PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
San Antonio River near Floresville affecting Wilson and Karnes Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Antonio River near Floresville.
* WHEN...From Friday morning to early Sunday afternoon.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 36.3 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.1 feet on 06/04/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 900 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
